body: @samuelrajan747 Hi, could you take a look at this?
I also found an error when working with PHPStan. I'm going to try to fix the annotations now.

issue.title: Fix PHPStan/Psalm annotations for `BaseArrayHelper::merge`

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️
| New feature?  | ❌
| Breaks BC?    | ❌
| Fixed issues  | #20437

body:
@EvilKarter @samuelrajan747 Please take a look this PR: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/20438

I also have a feeling that PHPStan is somehow incorrectly interpreting the type of the `$b` argument. It looks like the entire array `$b` is being passed to TValueB, which is why it was previously defined as `array<array<TKeyB, TValueB>>`. It might be worth creating an issue in PHPStan.

I replaced the types with `array<array-key, mixed>`, because we can't describe the result more accurately anyway.
We can't describe the keys accurately because there is an `UnsetArrayValue` helper that removes the key during merging.
We cannot describe the values more precisely, as the arrays are merged recursively. There will also be problems with the `UnsetArrayValue` and `ReplaceArrayValue` helpers when defining value types.
@max-s-lab, @EvilKarter - IMHO - The whole point of the change is to get the output types based on the input types, instead of blindly being mixed. Let me raise in phpstan.
@samuelrajan747 As I mentioned above, I don't see any way to do this accurately enough. It would be great if you could.

Apologies, upon going through the case mentioned here in the screenshot, I can now understand that the change I did will never work for shaped arrays. My primary use cases for the change were the attributes, fields, rules, attributeLables functions in active record models, which are pretty standard and fixed.
